page.title: 08FARM, CAERGWANAF UCHAF
page.content: {ECOLOGY:}Located 1 mile W.S.W. of Miskin village on Hensol Rd., on north sloping land descending to R. Ely. Soils mixture of clays, alluvium, ironstones, limestone topsoils. Trees are deciduous in hedges copses and spinneys. {ORGANISATION:}Run by Mr. Sparkes and his son with part-time help from wife and 1 daughter on progressive lines. Before M4 was a dairy unit but is now a mixture of cows and sheep for fattening, hay barley and oats for fodder and fields for potatoes and kidney beans, onions, leeks, cabbages. {PRODUCTS:}Cows and sheep fattened, 2 breeding sows, 24 piglets, kitchen vegetables and geese and turkeys fattened for Christmas trade. Markets are Cowbridge, Monmouth and contract such as Mr. W.R. Bishop (local vegetable wholesaler)
